articles.title: Understanding Sexual Health
articles.content: Sexual health is an important part of overall well-being.

articles.title: Common STIs
articles.content: The common STIs are gonorrhoea,HPV,chlamydia,syphilis and hepatisis B..

articles.title: How to Talk About Sexual Health
articles.content: Talking openly about sexual health with partners and healthcare providers is key to staying safe and healthy.

articles.title: The Importance of Regular Checkups
articles.content: Regular checkups can help you stay on top of your sexual health and catch any issues early.

articles.title: Safe Practices for Sexual Health
articles.content: This article covers safe practices to prevent infections and maintain sexual health.

articles.title: General Prevention Tips
articles.content: 1.Always use condoms or dental dams 2.Regular testing if one is sexually active 3.Have one sexual patner and practise monogamy if married

questions.question: What are the early symptoms of an STI?
questions.answer: Early symptoms of STIs may include unusual discharge, burning during urination, or sores. Consult a doctor for accurate diagnosis.

questions.question: How often should I get tested for STIs?
questions.answer: It's recommended to get tested at least once a year, or more frequently if you have multiple partners.

questions.question: Can I get an STI even with protection?
questions.answer: While protection greatly reduces the risk, some STIs can still be transmitted through skin-to-skin contact.

questions.question: Are there any at-home STI tests available?
questions.answer: Yes, there are reliable at-home STI testing kits available for discreet testing.

questions.question: What should I do if I suspect I have an STI?
questions.answer: You should consult a healthcare provider for testing and treatment if you suspect you have an STI.
